cvar.name: YACCCOM
cvar.summary: The command line used to call the parser generator to generate a source file.

cvar.name: YACCCOMSTR
cvar.summary:
The string displayed when generating a source file using the parser generator. If this is not set, then &cv-YACCCOM; (the command line) is displayed.
env = Environment(YACCCOMSTR = "Yacc'ing $TARGET from $SOURCES")

cvar.name: YACCFLAGS
cvar.summary: General options passed to the parser generator. If &cv-YACCFLAGS; contains a -d option, SCons assumes that the call will also create a .h file (if the yacc source file ends in a .y suffix) or a .hpp file (if the yacc source file ends in a .yy suffix)

cvar.name: YACCHFILESUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix of the C header file generated by the parser generator when the -d option is used. Note that setting this variable does not cause the parser generator to generate a header file with the specified suffix, it exists to allow you to specify what suffix the parser generator will use of its own accord. The default value is .h.

cvar.name: YACCHXXFILESUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix of the C++ header file generated by the parser generator when the -d option is used. Note that setting this variable does not cause the parser generator to generate a header file with the specified suffix, it exists to allow you to specify what suffix the parser generator will use of its own accord. The default value is .hpp.
